item.title: Junior Civil Society Expert familiar with Enlargement Agenda in Western Balkans and Turkey
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Mid-term Evaluation of the Civil Society Facility for the Western Balkans and Turkey

This is a mid-term evaluation of EU’s support to civil society organisations in the Western Balkans (namely in Albania, Bosnia and Herzegovina; Croatia; former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia; Kosovo, Montenegro and Serbia) and Turkey over the period 2011-2016 in the context of the EU enlargement policy.

The primary objective of the evaluation is to assess the performance of financial assistance in achieving its objectives, and namely, its relevance, efficiency, effectiveness, EU added value, coherence, complementarity and consistency as well as impact and sustainability.

The evaluation will also provide findings and recommendations to assist the Directorate General for Neighbourhood and Enlargement Negotiations of the European Commission (DG NEAR) in the programming and implementation of EU pre-accession assistance to support civil society in candidate and potential candidate countries with a view of improving the instruments available.

Junior Civil Society Expert familiar with Enlargement Agenda in Western Balkans and Turkey

Qualifications and skills: Education at least Master’s degree Academic Level (where a university degree has been awarded on completion of four years study in a university or equivalent institution) in social sciences, public affairs, political sciences, international relations or related field or, in its absence, at least 5 years of professional experience in the same fields.

General Professional Experience: At least 3 years of professional experience in evaluation, project cycle management, sound financial management audit, monitoring or academic research

Specific Professional Experience:

  • At least 3 years professional experience in the field of Civil Society.
  • Familiar with the European institutional environment and the Enlargement agenda in the Western Balkans and Turkey.
  • Familiar with the role of civil society in the Western Balkans and Turkey, including opportunities and challenges faced.
  • Demonstrated interpersonal and diplomatic skills, as well as the ability to communicate effectively with all stakeholders and to present ideas clearly and effectively.
  • Knowledge of any local languages in the region (WBT) will be an advantage.

The minimum requirement for the team as a whole are:

  • Knowledge and experience covering at least 80% of the sectors of implementation of CSO grants and contracts under the CSF as per background
  • Excellent oral and writing skills in English (level 1 in a scale from 1 to 5, where 1 is “excellent” and 5 is “basic” (all the experts)
  • Very good knowledge of the history, culture, social and political situation of the Western Balkans and Turkey
  • Very good knowledge of the European institutional environment and the Enlargement agenda in the Western Balkans and Turkey
  • Advanced understanding of democratization and civil society related issues
  • At least one of the experts should possess IT and database management capacities
  • Command of the following languages would be considered an advantage: Albanian, Serbo-Croat-Bosnian, Macedonian and Turkish (team as a whole)

item.title: Expert 2 and 3: Data Collection Analyst on Gender Equality in Public Administration
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
*Study on Gender Equality in Public Administration in the Western Balkans *

Global objective The overall objective of this assignment is to contribute to strengthening girl’s and women’s voice and participation in the Western Balkans, in particular, women’s empowerment and expanded participation in policy-making and leadership in the executive branch of the state.

Specific objectives

The study will cover the Western Balkans (Albania, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Kosovo, the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Montenegro and Serbia) and should achieve the following specific objectives:

  • Provide an overview of the current state-of-play, gaps, barriers and challenges to women’s participation in decision-making, both participation in public policy/strategy development and participation in leadership positions. The analysis will focus on the thematic area ‘strengthening voice and participation’ identified in the Gender Action Plan.
  • Analyse country-specific legal frameworks, policies and initiatives indicating major constraints and enabling factors of promoting gender equality and women’s empowerment in public administration.
  • Identify policy and programming recommendations for further action, including specific entry points for the EC to advance women’s equal participation in public administration in the Western Balkans.

Expert 2 and 3: Data Collection Analyst on Gender Equality in Public Administration (maximum 70 working days)

These Category III analysts shall:

  • Carry out data collection on Gender Equality in Public Administration in all the Western Balkan countries;
  • Support the Team Leader on desk review of findings and data;
  • Contribute to the drafting of all deliverables of the study;
  • Draft initial correspondence requesting data, including a brief questionnaire;
  • Proactively contact institution/agency/department that house civil servant data in all countries in the region;
  • Continue correspondence, with the support of the team leader, until any available data is collected. Organize collected data;
  • Synthesize findings into a first-level analysis on the availability of data. Summarize experience and lessons-learned from data collection efforts.
  • Performing supporting and administrative activities related to the project implementation.

Competencies:

  • Strong command of data collection and analysis;
  • Strong communication, organization, and time management skills;
  • Ability to perform tasks in timely manner and under pressure, to tight deadlines;
  • Ability to communicate in English verbally and in writing with a wide range of stakeholders (e.g. government officials, civil society organizations, etc.) and ability to work collaboratively online and via email;
  • Able to work independently and as part of a team seamlessly using a range of modern means of communication.

Qualifications and skills:

Education:

  • University Degree in relevant area such as Public Administration, Public Policy, Social and Political Sciences, Gender Studies, International Law, Development Studies, or equivalent.

General experience

  • At least 3 years of relevant professional experience in gender and/or one or more of the areas of, governance (with particular emphasis on public administration reforms)
  • Experience with extensive online research;
  • Experience with quantitative research and data collection;
  • Knowledge of decision-making processes in public policy, public service delivery, institutional capacity building, human resource management policies, professional ethics and/or civil service reform would be desirable.

Specific experience

  • Good knowledge of the international framework on gender equality and women’s empowerment, particularly in the area of women’s participation in policy and decision-making and leadership;
  • Knowledge of the EU Gender Equality Policy and Gender Action Plan would be considered an asset;
  • Previous experience in the Western Balkans in issues related to public administration reform and/or gender equality will be a strong asset.

Language skills:

  • Excellent spoken and written English
  • Knowledge of any of the languages spoken in the Western Balkans would be a distinctive advantage.

The specific objective of this assignment is to assist the European Commission preparation and formulation of an action on Social and Solidarity Economy for the following Countries: USA, Brazil, Mexico, India and South Korea. A preliminary study will be produced to assess the feasibility of a structured cooperation project on SSE.

Introducing SSE as a mean of doing business differently will help/allow the more socially and inclusive innovative stakeholders of the private sector and civil society to play a decisive role for growth and development, in the Single Market and worldwide.

The objective of this action is to contribute fostering the supportive ecosystems for social enterprises, in order to create space for them to continue contributing in shaping and implementing markets and business conduct models aimed at sustainable, inclusive, fairer and equitable economic growth.

Senior Expert for SSE in the Americas (Category I)

Qualifications and skills

  • Master Degree or equivalent diploma in an area relevant to SSE (Law, Business, Economy, etc.) or equivalent experience of 3 years which must be additional to the general professional experience duration fixed below;
  • Proven knowledge of SSE policies and strategies, in particular the EU SBI;
  • Proven excellent writing and oral communication skills in English;
  • Good communication skills in French, Spanish and/or Portuguese are an asset.

General professional experience

  • At least 12 years of experience in the sectors related to Trade, Standards and Private sector.

Specific professional experience

  • At least 5 years of professional experience in the field of SSE, the analysis of SSE policies, including legal and institutional aspects;
  • At least 2 years of professional experience related to SSE in the Americas;
  • At least 3 relevant professional experiences as expert for identification or formulation for relevant EU funded programmes;
  • Professional experience related to SSE and carried out in USA, Mexico and/or in Brazil is an advantage.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to elena_bellitto@dai.com

item.title: Food Safety Expert
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Preparation of twinning fiche for Strengthening the Veterinary Services and Food Safety Capacities of the Lebanese Ministry of Agriculture

The specific objectives of the project could be summarized as follows:

  • Enhance capacities of the Veterinary Services of the Lebanese Ministry of Agriculture
  • Strengthen food safety and quality systems for products of animal origin.

The following results are expected:

  • Veterinary regulations harmonized with EU regulation and enforced
  • Upgrading of Institutional and operational capacities of the Veterinary Services
  • Capacity building of the MoA Veterinary Services and other concerned staff

The final output foreseen is a Twinning Fiche which includes notably the description of the action, the necessary time frame/work plan for proper implementation, the logical framework matrix, budget.

Project duration: December 2016-March 2017 (87 working days)

Expert n°2: Food Safety Expert, 15 w/d

This expert should have a background in food safety as related to animal products. S/he should be knowledgeable with the EU Rules and Procedures. S/he should have the following profile:

Qualifications and Skills:

  • Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM) or at least a Masters Degree in a relevant, directly related discipline
  • Sound communications skills
  • Able to work in close cooperation with all international and local stakeholders

General Professional Experience:

item.title: EU Procedures, Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) and Formulation Expert (Cat. I)
item.author: Penny Buckle
item.description:
Evaluation, Re-formulation and Monitoring of a Decentralisation Project

The overall objective of the assignment is to compile and analyse the necessary information for the EU Delegation in Jordan to make an informed decision on the way forward regarding the project “Decentralisation and Local Development Support Programme (DLDSP)”.

The specific objectives of the assignment include:

  • To conduct an evaluation of the above-mentioned project.
  • To reformulate the project, if deemed relevant and feasible, under a new approach.
  • To monitor the remaining period of implementation of the project.

EU Procedures, Monitoring & Evaluation (M&E) and Formulation Expert (Cat. I)

  • Postgraduate degree in law, political sciences, public administration, economics, international relations; or undergraduate degree in these specialities with additional 2-year experience.
  • At least 12 years of experience working for European Union institutions, governmental institutions, development cooperation agencies, regional or local authorities, international organisations, development cooperation agencies, regional or local authorities, international organisations, consultancy firms, civil society and/or non-governmental organisations in the management, implementation, identification, formulation, monitoring or evaluation of development or technical cooperation projects/programmes funded by the European Union.
  • At least 6 years of experience and demonstrated knowledge of the EU’s external action and of EU procedures for the delivery of aid and cooperation to third countries.
  • Experience in working on decentralisation, electoral assistance, in particular local and regional elections, civic education, voter information and public awareness in the framework of development/technical cooperation projects/programmes will be considered a strong asset.
  • Experience in UN policies and procedures will be considered an asset.
  • Excellent of both spoken and written English.
  • Excellent communications, drafting, reporting and project-budgeting skills.

If you meet the requirements and would be interested in applying for this role please email your CV in EC format to Aurelie_Durand@dai.com
